definitions.text: a basis for comparison; a reference point against which other things can be evaluated
examples: the schools comply with federal standards
they set the measure for all subsequent work

definitions.text: the ideal in terms of which something can be judged
examples: they live by the standards of their community

definitions.text: the value behind the money in a monetary system
an upright pole or beam (especially one used as a support)
examples: distance was marked by standards every mile
lamps supported on standards provided illumination

definitions.text: conforming to or constituting a standard of measurement or value; or of the usual or regularized or accepted kind
established or well-known or widely recognized as a model of authority or excellence
examples: the classical argument between free trade and protectionism

definitions.text: conforming to the established language usage of educated native speakers;  (American);  (British)
examples: received standard English is sometimes called the King's English

definitions.text: regularly and widely used or sold
